title: Strictly's Michelle Visage's inspiring message and praises Giovanni
text:
Michelle Visage has posted a heartfelt message about embracing being ‘a lady of a certain age’ and still killing it on Strictly Come Dancing.

The RuPaul’s Drag Race judge stormed to the top of the leader board during this week’s Movie Week theme.

Her performance to Liza Minelli track (Life Is A) Cabaret with pro partner Giovanni Pernice earned them the show’s first 9’s of the evening with a total score of 35.

While she eventually missed the top spot to Kelvin Fletcher and Oti Mabuse performing Trip A Little Light Fantastic from Mary Poppins Returns, she was still more than chuffed with what was accomplished.

She wrote: ‘Words cannot express how grateful I am for this opportunity. I’m a 51 year old mother of two, who gets to learn how to dance from a world champion on national telly. THIS is a dream.’

Advertisement

Advertisement

‘I am NOT a dancer and you all are so wonderful to be there with me and root for me and cheer me on to believe that I CAN be a dancer,’ she continued. ‘You are my life force. You are my soul.

‘When I think I can’t do it, I think of you all expecting the best from #Team Visagio’

‘I hope to never let you or [Giovanni] down and I promise you with all of my heart I will always work my hardest and never go down without a fight,’ Michelle added.

She concluded: ‘THANK YOU for all of the amazing comments. I TRULY love you all and we are in this together, especially us ladies “of a certain age” who were told we are too old to do things like this!

‘NOT ON MY WATCH, WE AREN’T! GIO AND I LOVE YOU’

Whether Michelle makes it through to next week on Strictly Come Dancing will be revealed on tonight’s show, but David James, Mike Bushell and Anneka Rice are not looking safe with the lowest scores of the evening.

More: Strictly Come Dancing Strictly stars 'asked to contact ex-partners' after Kelvin Fletcher nude video 'leak' Strictly's Katya Jones denies being 'drunk' and insists she staged second fall Strictly’s Craig Revel Horwood apologises to Anton Du Beke after ‘fake teeth’ gaffe

Mike and his pro Katya Jones suffered a particular rough time of it in the live show as Katya went flying across the dancefloor in the final moments of their Magic Mike inspired routine.

Advertisement

Advertisement

She later tripped up again as she made it up the stairs to talk to Claudia – though that one might have been on purpose to add a little comedic flare to the proceedings.

Strictly Come Dancing continues tonight at 6.40pm on BBC One.

description: Drag Race judge Michelle Visage has been storming Strictly Come Dancing - and wants to encourage others to embrace their potential too
